title: 9: Markets and Morality
itunes:author: Philosophy Talk Starters
itunes:summary:
More at http://philosophytalk.org/shows/markets-and-morality.

Does the free market provide incentives for behavior that is problematic from a moral perspective? Or does the free market punish morally problematic behavior? Is respecting the free market itself moral, insofar as respecting the free market is also respecting individual freedom of choice? Ken, John and Elizabeth Anderson take on the topic of markets and morality.
